required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improvement of Cerebrovascular Autoregulation in Patients With Septic Shock Due to Cytokine Elimination
clinical_study.official_title: Verbesserung Einer gestörten zerebrovaskulären Autoregulation Bei Patienten im Septischen Schock Durch Extrakorporale Reduktion Von Entzündungsmediatoren

brief_summary.textblock: The trial investigates the effect of cytokine elimination in patients with septic schock and acute renal failure with need for renal replacement therapy on the integrity of cerebrovascular autoregulation. Patients with inclusion criteria were randomly assign in either use of CytoSorb filter integrated in renal replacement therapy versus non additional filter an renal replacement therapy alone. Cerebrovascular autoregulation will be measured with transcranial Doppler ultrasound and correlation with arterial blood pressure.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in the index of cerebrovascular autoregulation (Mx) between both groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: days 1 to 4 after diagnosis of septic shock
primary_outcome.description: Integrity of the cerebrovascular autoregulation will be measured using the index of cerebrovascular autoregulation Mx (moving correlation index). Outcome is the difference of the mean Mx between both groups and, therefore, the difference of integrity of the cerbrovascular autoregulation. A difference of 0.2 in Mx was set as clinically relevant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- septic shock
- acute renal failure with need for renal replacement therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- nursing
- impossibility to do transcranial Doppler ultrasound

facility.name: University Medical Center of the Johannes Gutenberg-Univerity

responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy intensive care unit, Principal investigator, medical doctor
